bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 15, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison discusses an issue of "True Comics," which featured the story about Lazear. He writes that he has subscribed to the publication and has ordered additional copies for local schoolchildren.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 15, 1941

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
March 15, 1941

div1.p:
We have this week the copy of “True Comics”
with the story of Lazear in it. This is a grand
stunt and we have written immediately and subscribed
to the little magazine for the children and have
ordered twenty-five copies of this issue for the
children in Mary's grade school. They have been
doing quite a bit with this Yellow Jack story in their
room. They have pictures of Lazear as a thirteen
year old boy and as a mature man and have had little
plays and have accomplished a good deal. Therefore
this book will be much appreciated. Thank you very
much for calling it to our attention.

I am very much disappointed that heavy
complications here have made it impossible for me to
get up there for my visit with you folks and,
incidentally, an examination. I presume the time is
fast approaching when you will go off on your
vacation so I shall now have to delay it until after
your return.

I hope you have a grand trip and a fine
vacation. Give our love to Mary and the children.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
